components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

components.name: Metrics Ingestion
components.description: The metrics ingestion pipeline that Servers and Gateways report to, enabling support of Studio analytics and features.

components.name: Schema Publishing
components.description: The Schema Publishing feature which is leveraged by tools like Server auto-reporting, `rover graph publish`, and `rover subgraph publish`.

components.name: Schema Checks
components.description: The Schema Checks feature enabling user workflows for commands like `rover graph check`, and `rover subgraph check`.

components.name: GraphQL API
components.description: The API that supports reading metrics, schemas, client metadata, publishing and validating schemas.

components.name: Notifications
components.description: This includes features like Slack, Webhooks, and Emails.

components.name: Studio Metrics Dashboard
components.description: The features of Apollo Studio that power viewing usage of your graph. This includes the fields page, clients page, operations page, and certain screens within other main tabs of the Studio application.

components.name: (experimental) Performance Alerts
components.description: Apollo Studio feature that supports alerting to Slack or Pagerduty based on latency, error, and request rates of operations.

components.name: ApolloGraphQL.com
components.description: This includes the homepage (www.apollographql.com), docs content, and blog content.

components.name: Datadog Forwarding
components.description: A feature of Apollo Studio that allows users to forward metrics observed via Apollo's telemetry pipeline to their Datadog instance(s).

components.name: Cloud Routing
components.description: GraphOS Cloud supergraphs hosted on Apollo infrastructure

incidents.name: Unable to create new Cloud Routers (Dedicated / Serverless)

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Currently, we are unable to create new cloud routers for our dedicated and serverless platforms. We are investigating the root cause.

components.name: Cloud Routing
components.description: GraphOS Cloud supergraphs hosted on Apollo infrastructure

scheduled_maintenances.name: Notice: GraphOS IP List Updates, Monday, 2024/08/12

incident_updates.body:
Please note:

If you are not using IP Allow Lists for Apollo’s DNS entries, this update does not apply to you, and there will be no impact to any GraphOS features. In general, if you are using corporate proxies or safe lists, Apollo recommends doing domain-based restrictions as opposed to IP-based restrictions.

On August 12, 2024:

Customers who use IP Allow Lists will be required to have an up to date version of IP addresses explicitly allowed in order to ensure full compliance with GraphOS. Provided customers using IP Allow Lists have these updates, there will be no downtime to any services in relation to Apollo.

As announced on May 1st, 2023, Apollo occasionally updates the IP addresses behind our APIs. Customers who use IP-based restrictions in their networks should reach out to Apollo Technical Support by going to our Help center or sending an email to support@apollographql.com to get an up-to-date list of IPs before August 12, 2024.

For more details, please see below and be sure to look over our announcement from May 1st, 2023.

We will be updating the IP addresses associated with these current Apollo API domains: • usage-reporting.api.apollographql.com (Metrics reporting from the Apollo Router (v0.1.0+), Apollo Server (v2.18.0+), and third-party API servers) • api.apollographql.com (All Rover CLI (v0.6+) commands that communicate with GraphOS, along with all requests to the GraphOS Platform API) • schema-reporting.api.apollographql.com (Schema registration via schema reporting in Apollo Server (v2.18.0+) and third-party API servers)
We will also be updating the IP addresses associated with these active legacy domains: • edge-server-reporting.api.apollographql.com (Schema registration via schema reporting in Apollo Server (v2.15.0-2.17.x)) • engine-report.apollodata.com (Metrics reporting from Apollo Server (v2.0-2.17.x))
